intro: Diaphananthe longicalcar, commonly known as the long-spined diaphananthe, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its woody stems and broad, ovate leaves with a smooth upper surface and hairy underside. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warm climates.
